title: From Cairo: Dinner Cruise on the Nile River
experiences:
Enjoy live entertainment while savoring a delicious open buffet dinner
Sail down the Nile River as you peer across the water towards the city's shining lights
Cruise from old Cairo to new Cairo as you take in the beautiful architecture
Experience a unique Arabic outing on this 2-hour journey
fullDescription:
Begin this wonderful dinner excursion from the lobby of your hotel at 6:30 PM. Join the 5-star deluxe Nile Cruise and set sail for a 2-hour trip from Cairo and discover the beauty of the ancient Egyptian city by night.

Take in the wonderful views of Cairo illuminated by the glaring city lights as you savor a special open buffet dinner. Enjoy a belly dance show, Arabic songs and music, along with a Tanoura show while delighting in your endless meal.

This amazing Arabian night experience ends with a drop-off at your hotel. Dinner is included in the tour price but beverages are not.
includes:
Private transfer from and to hotel
Open buffet dinner
Live entertainment
All taxes and services

title: Cairo and Giza Full-Day Highlights Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
Discover the last surviving 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Explore the ancient pyramids of the Giza Plateau
See antiquities of Ancient Egypt at the Egyptian Museum
Add on optional extra camel rides and more
Learn more about the pharaohs of Ancient Egypt
fullDescription:
Travel back in time to experience the heritage of Pharaonic Egypt on a full-day tour to Cairo and Giza, with transfers by air-conditioned vehicles from the Red Sea.

Following a pick-up from your hotel, get some great views of the landscape en route to the Egyptian capital. Stops can be made whenever you require. Upon arrival in Cairo, visit the Egyptian Museum on Tahrir Square, and discover one of the most comprehensive collections of Ancient Egyptian relics in the world. Explore treasures that tell the story of a highly-developed culture.

For a supplement, you can enter the Mummy Room to learn all about the mummification process, and come face-to-face with some of the Egyptian royals of the Pharonic days in mummified form.

Transfer to Giza in the afternoon to see the Great Pyramids and Great Sphinx in the Giza Plateau. Marvel at this last surviving monument of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, built more than 4.500 years ago as everlasting graves for the pharaohs Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinos.

Marvel at the mysterious Sphinx statue of a Pharaoh’s head with a lion’s body. Optional activities in Giza upon payment of a supplement include a look inside the Great Pyramid or Small Pyramid, a ride on a camel, or a visit to the Solar Boat Museum, where you will see the legendary boat that Pharaoh Cheops had built in order to sail through the underworld

Transfer back to your hotel in the evening for the end of tour services.
includes:
Transfers from/to your hotel and between the sights by high-class air-conditioned vehicles
Guided tours in your language
Entrance fees for the above mentioned sights
Lunch in a local restaurant

title: Private Transfer between Cairo Airport & Cairo/Giza
experiences:
Relax, knowing your driver will track your flight and allow for delays and early arrivals to Cairo International Airport
Sit back and relax as you are transported through Cairo in comfort
Watch the scenery in comfort as your driver takes you from Cairo International Airport to the destination of your choice
Trust your experienced driver to navigate the complicated streets of Cairo and Giza
Enjoy Cairo and Giza's scenery without having to worry about traffic or maps
fullDescription:
Enjoy a private airport transfer from Cairo Airport International to either Cairo or Giza, getting you to your destination comfortably and quickly.

When you arrive to Cairo airport you should buy the entry Visa stamps from any bank inside the terminal itself for $15. each, then paste it inside any empty page at your passport and go to the officer window to put the arrival seal on it. After putting the arrival seal on your passport, go to the luggage belt. Get your luggage and take the way out. In front of the exit gate you will find our representative with a sign of your name. Then you will be transferred by a private, air-conditioned car to your hotel in either Cairo or Giza.

This transfer is also available from Cairo or Giza to Cairo International Airport.
includes:
Transfer from Cairo International Airport to hotel in Cairo or Giza
Private, air-conditioned van
All taxes and services

title: Full-Day Tour of Historical Alexandria from Cairo, Egypt
experiences:
Relax with comfortable air-conditioned transfers.
Benefit from informative and professional Egyptologist guides.
Discover the main attractions of ancient Alexandria including the Roman Theatre and the Catacombs of Kom el Shaqafa
Stroll the ramparts of the 15th-century Qaitbay Citadel.
Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a quality local restaurant.
fullDescription:
Explore the rich history of Alexandria; tracing time from its ancient Egyptian roots, through the Classical period, to Roman times and beyond on an informative full-day tour from Cairo. Enjoy meet-and-greet service pick-up, and drop off from your Cairo hotel, and the comfort of an air-conditioned bus.

Begin the journey with a visit to the Roman theater in Kom El-Deka; a marble theater that once seated 800 spectators with galleries, sections of mosaic flooring, and a pleasure garden, all surrounded by Roman baths and villas.

Continuing, explore the Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa; the necropolis of 3 sub-levels dating from the 2nd century AD merges aspects of Egyptian, Greek, and Roman culture in its features. See the Roman triclinium – a banquet hall to honor the dead, as well as statues, reliefs, and a pillared lobby featuring depictions of Egyptian gods in Roman armor.

See the site of the Alexandria Library. Concluding the tour, walk the ramparts of the 15th century Qaitbay Citadel, built upon the ruins of the ancient Alexandria Lighthouse. End this day of discovery with a relaxed evening drive back to Cairo, and your hotel.
includes:
Transportation in air-conditioned deluxe van
2 English-speaking Egyptologist guides
3 entry-fees
Lunch at quality local restaurant (excluding beverages)
Bottled water
taxes and service charges

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramid, Sakkara & Memphis Full Day Private Tour
experiences:
Marvel at the famous Great Pyramids of Giza with your Egyptologist guide
See the ancient Step Pyramid of Djoser at the Sakkara archeological site
Visit Egypt's former capital of Memphis, once the cultural center of the ancient world
fullDescription:
Great Pyramids & Sphinx (Giza Pyramid Complex ) , Saqqara Step Pyramids and Memphis open air Museum :

Start your day with an 08:00 AM pick-up at your hotel and travel with your guide to the Giza Plateau. On this 9-hour tour you’ll visit the Great Pyramids, the ancient capital of Memphis and the Step Pyramid of Djoser in Saqqara.

When you reach the Giza Plateau, your Egyptology guide will introduce you to the famous Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus.

Marvel at the Great Sphinx statue and visit the Valley Temple, which is a part of the same ancient complex. Learn about the burial rites of the pharaohs.

The next stop on the tour is the Step Pyramid of King Djoser, at the fascinating Saqqara archaeological site. Built around 2630 BC, this special pyramid is the world's oldest major stone structure.

You’ll continue on to Memphis, the capital of ancient Egypt. Having reigned as a cultural center for over 3,000 years, Memphis boasts stunning ancient sites.
includes:
Pick-up and drop off at hotels in Cairo and Giza
Transportation by air-conditioned private car
Professional Egyptologist tour guide
Bottle of water for each participant
All services and taxes

title: Giza Pyramids, Sphinx and Sakkara - Private Full Day Tour
experiences:
Go on a private full day tour of the Giza Pyramids, the Sphinx, Memphis and Sakkara with a qualified Egyptologist
Go inside of the Great Pyramids and visit the Mummies room
View the Step Pyramid in Sakkara, only 27km from Cairo
fullDescription:
Embark on a full-day tour to the Giza Pyramids, the Sphinx, Memphis and Sakkara.

Start your tour by visiting the Great Pyramids - Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos. The highlight of this section is getting close up to the Sphinx - the legendary guardian with a lion’s body and the head of King Chephren. Admire the impressive statue and get your photo taken beside it.
You will then visit Sakkara, a 27 km journey away from Cairo. The highlight of this section is the Step Pyramid. Built for King Zoser, it is considered an important part in the process of the pyramid evolution.

Finally, you'll head over to Memphis. Not the home of Elvis, of course, but the ancient capital of Egypt!
includes:
Expert tour guide (Egyptologist)
Pick-up and drop off transfers by private air-conditioned vehicle
Bottles of water
Taxes and services

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramids Sound and Light Show with Dinner
experiences:
Experience the magic of the Pyramids of Giza at night
Learn more about the ancient pharaohs during a spectacular sound and light show
Enjoy a delicious dinner at a local restaurant
Marvel as the Great Sphinx comes to life and speaks the words of a long dead Egyptian ruler
Get great views of the pyramids illuminated at night
fullDescription:
If you’ve been impressed by the Pyramids of Giza by daylight, experience the magic of the monuments at night with a ticket to the Sound and Light Show in the Giza Plateau.

Transfer from Cairo by air-conditioned van, and take your seats in the spectacular setting of the pyramids and Great Sphinx in the desert. A recorded commentary will tell the story of the Pharoahs of Ancient Egypt as images are projected on to the temple walls.

Learn more about Ancient Egypt and each ruin as the story unfolds, climaxing when the Great Sphinx comes to life and speaks the words of a long dead pharaoh. End with a delicious dinner at a local restaurant before the transfer back to your hotel in Cairo.
includes:
Transfers from Cairo by air-conditioned deluxe van
English-speaking Egyptologist guide
Entry fees
Dinner at a local restaurant (beverages not included)
All taxes and service charges

title: Hurghada: Full-Day Trip to Cairo and Giza Highlights
experiences:
Explore the oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World at Giza
Tour the Old Town of Cairo
Go to the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Square
Marvel at the high Pyramid of Khufu, the oldest in the Giza Plateau
Learn how the pyramids were built from an Egyptologist guide
See the reclining statue of the Great Sphinx
fullDescription:
Discover the “City of a Thousand Minarets” on a full-day tour of Cairo, with round-trip transfers by bus from Hurghada. Relax in air-conditioned comfort on the long journey, admiring views of the Gulf of Suez.

Upon arrival, your private Egyptologist guide will take you to Giza Plateau to see the oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World. Get breathtaking views of the Pyramids of Giza as you explore the mortuary temples of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Learn the story of how the temples were constructed, and hear the stories behind their legends.

Continue to the Great Sphinx, the giant statue of a reclining mythical beast with a lion’s body and the face of the Pharaoh Khafre. Go to the Valley Temple opposite, attributed to the Pharaoh Khafre, and marvel at the feat of ancient engineering.

After lunch, drive into central Cairo to explore the artifacts of the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Square. Designed by French architect Marcel Dourgnon, the museum’s collections exceed 120,000 masterpieces from the pre-dynastic to the Pharaonic and Greco-Roman periods. Learn about the mummification art of Ancient Egypt before your return transfer to Hurghada.
includes:
Transfers by air conditioned van
Egyptologist guide
Entrance fees
Lunch at a local specialty restaurant

title: Hurghada: Day Trip to Cairo by Plane with Transfers
experiences:
Visit the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Marvel at the Great Sphinx and explore the Valley Temple
Admire the vast array of artifacts at the world-renowned Museum of Egyptian Antiquities
fullDescription:
Marvel at the majesty of the Great Pyramid of Giza and the treasures of the Egyptian Museum. With your own private Egyptologist guide you’ll enjoy this full-day exploration of Cairo.

Early in the morning, you’ll be picked up at your hotel in Hurghada by air-conditioned van for the transfer to Hurghada airport and your flight to Cairo. When you arrive you’ll meet your Egyptologist guide and begin the tour with a visit the famous Giza Plateau.

Marvel at the Great Pyramid, one of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, as well as the other 2 pyramids and mysterious Sphinx, the Father of Terror for the ancient pharaohs.

The tour also includes a visit to the Valley Temple that faces the great Sphinx, before you stop for lunch at a good quality restaurant.

After lunch you’ll visit old Cairo with your guide before heading to the world-renowned Museum of Egyptian Antiquities. Built in the neo-classical style and designed by the French architect Marcel Dourgnon, the Museum is home to more than 120,000 masterpieces of Egyptian art and artifacts.

After some free time in Cairo you’ll be transferred to the airport for your return flight to Hurghada, followed by a direct transfer to your hotel.
includes:
Transfers from Hurghada by air-conditioned van
Egyptologist tour guide
Flight tickets
Entrance fees to the attractions mentioned in the description
Restaurant lunch during the tour

title: Luxor Guided Tour with Overnight 1st Class Train from Cairo
experiences:
Travel from Cairo to Luxor by 1st class train
Discover the ancient temples of the East Bank of Luxor
Explore the necropolis in the Valley of the Kings on the West Bank of Luxor
fullDescription:
See some of the finest monuments from Ancient Egypt on a guided tour of the East Bank and West Bank of Luxor. Catch the overnight train from Cairo and get wonderful views of the Nile River Valley at the first light of day.

Day 1:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Cairo or Giza, and then travel to the train station to catch the overnight 1st-class train to Luxor.

Day 2:
Arrive at Luxor in the morning and meet a licensed tour guide to take a tour of the monuments by private air-conditioned vehicle. Start on the West Bank and visit the Valley Of The Kings, last resting place of the kings Tutmosis I, Tutmosis III, Tut-Ankh-Amon, Ramssess VI, Mrenptah and Amonhotep II.

Continue to the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut, and learn about the only female ruler of Ancient Egypt. Discover the mortuary temple of Amenhotep III at the Colossi of Memnon, and then cross to the East Bank to explore the most splendid site of worship at the Karnak Temple. Visit the Temple of Luxor before getting dropped off at the station to take the overnight train back to Cairo.
includes:
Pick-up from your hotel in Cairo or Giza
Pick-up and drop off at the train station in Luxor
All transfers by private air-conditioned coach
Professional tour guide in your chosen language
Round-trip 1st class train ticket from Cairo to Luxor (or by bus, if you prefer)
All taxes and service charges

title: Giza Pyramids & Sphinx, Saqqara & Dahshur Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Get up close to the Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx
Learn more about Ancient Egypt from an expert guide
Visit the step pyramid of the Pharaoh Djoser at the archaeological site of Saqqara
Hear how pyramids were built
Marvel at the unique Bent Pyramid in Dahshur
fullDescription:
Journey back in time to the days of Ancient Egypt and go to the Giza Plateau to see the legendary pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus. Get up close to the Great Sphinx and visit the Valley Temple on the site where the pharaohs were laid to rest.

Next, journey to the Step Pyramid of Djoser in the archaeological remains of the necropolis of Saqqara. Learn more about Pharaoh Djoser from your Egyptologist guide. Continue to Dahshur on the west bank of the River Nile and go inside the unfinished Red Pyramid, named for the rusty color of its limestone rocks.

Learn how the pyramids were built.
includes:
Pick-up and drop off at your hotel in Cairo or Giza
Transportation by private, air-conditioned car
Expert Egyptologist guide
Bottle of water per person
All services and taxes

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramids, Egyptian Museum & Bazaar Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Explore the history and culture of Ancient Egypt
Wander through 120,000 masterpieces of art at the Egyptian Museum
See the treasures from the Tomb of Tutankhamen
Visit the Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx, the last remaining of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Pick up some souvenir bargains and learn to haggle at the Khan El Khalili Bazaar
fullDescription:
Enjoy a full-day tour exploring the history and culture of Egypt at the Egyptian Museum, Great Pyramids of Giza, and Great Sphinx. Then, shop for unique bargains in the historic Khan El Khalili Bazaar. An expert Egyptologist guide will be on hand at all times to offer helpful explanations of this most ancient of civilizations.

Start your tour at the Egyptian Museum. Designed by the French architect Marcel Dourgnon, the museum is located in a handsome neo-classical building on Tahrir Square. Its collections exceed 120,000 masterpieces, ranging from the pre-dynastic era, to the Pharaonic and Greco-Roman periods. Undoubted highlights are the collection of rare treasures of King Tutankhamen, and the Mummies Room, which you can enter for a small extra charge.

Continue to the Great Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx, the oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, and the last still standing. Explore the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Your guide will describe the story of their monumental construction, and tell you about their mysteries, before you explore inside one of the pyramids.

Proceed to the Great Sphinx, imposingly standing in the desert sand after thousands of years. Admire the colossal structure, before moving to the Valley Temple of the Pyramid of Cephren.

Drive back to central Cairo and end your day at the lively Khan El Khalili Bazaar. Master the art of bargaining for great prices on fine brassware, copper, perfumes, leather, silver, gold, and antiques.
includes:
Pick-up and drop off transfers in a private air-conditioned vehicle
English-speaking Egyptologist guide
Bottle of water
Taxes and services

title: Great Pyramids and Sphinx Adventure
experiences:
Visit the iconic Pyramids of Giza before the crowds and the heat
Tour inside the Valley Temple and marvel at its construction
Enjoy spectacular views of the Sphinx and the overall Giza Plateau
fullDescription:
Experience the magic of the Land of the Pharaohs on a 5-hour visit to the Giza Plateau with an Egyptologist guide. Travel in air-conditioned comfort and start out with a visit to the Great Pyramid.

Continue to the second pyramid, which is also the second-largest and the only pyramid that retains part of its original casing. See the third and smallest of the pyramids as well.

Visit the interior of the Valley Temple and marvel at the construction. See the Great Sphinx of Giza, a statue with the body of a lion and the head of a man.

Stop at the panoramic viewpoint to take in all the pyramids from one spot.
includes:
Pick-up and drop off at hotels in Cairo and Giza
Transportation by private, air-conditioned car
Professional Egyptologist guide
Bottle of water
All service fees and taxes

title: From Cairo: Full-Day Tour to Alexandria with Lunch
experiences:
Explore the Greco-Roman city of Alexandria
See the triumphal column of Pompey's Pillar
Visit the largest library in the world
Marvel at the Citadel of Qaitbay, where the Lighthouse of Alexandria once stood
fullDescription:
Discover the "Pearl of the Mediterranean" on a full-day tour of Alexandria by air-conditioned car from Cairo or Giza.

Relax on the 3-hour journey, and on arrival see the fascinating attractions, such as the triumphal column of Pompey's Pillar, built in honor of the emperor Diocletian at the end of the 4th century. Go to the beautiful Citadel of Qaitbay on the site where the Lighthouse of Alexandria once stood.

Discover a large Roman cemetery carved in rock at the Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa, and then explore the history of the Library of Alexandria, one of the largest and most famous libraries in the world.
includes:
Transportation by private, air-conditioned car
Hotel pick-up and drop off in Cairo or Giza
Expert Egyptologist guide in your chosen language
Bottle of water per person

title: Cairo: Quad Bike Desert Safari around Giza Pyramids
experiences:
Enjoy a quad bike tour around the Giza Pyramids
Discover the desert around Cairo
Take a close-up look at the Sphinx
fullDescription:
After a pick-up from your hotel in Cairo or Giza, you will be transferred to the Giza Pyramids. This is the starting point for your easy quad bike ride. The tour is simply the most exciting way to discover all the ancient wonders of Egypt. The custom-made buggies are capable of whisking over the dunes at speeds over 50 mph taking you to places where most tourists never get to see. Riding through the desert is a thrilling experience and will make your holiday in Egypt unforgettable.

Take amazing pictures and see the Great Pyramids - Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos. After this, visit the Valley Temple and have a close-up look at the Sphinx. At the end of your tour you will be taken back to your hotel.
includes:
Transportation
Entry fees
Tour guide
Lunch at a local restaurant

title: Cairo: Sound & Light Show Giza Pyramids
experiences:
Enjoy Giza pyramids plateau after sunset
Watch fantastic visuals projected onto the ancient Giza Pyramids
Enjoy the Sound and Light show at the Giza Pyramids
fullDescription:
Try something different by attending the dazzling Sound and Light show at the Giza Pyramids of Cheops, Chefren and Mykerinus. The Sound and Light show will whisk you away on a narrated journey of Egypt's history through dramatic storytelling, lights, and music. Watch as lights illuminate the sphinx and pyramids, in a show considered one of the best tourist attractions in Cairo.

Begin your show with the tale of the Sphinx, who has been the vigilant guardian of the city of the dead for 5,000 years. Discover the story of the building of the pyramids, as well as the history of famous figures from ancient Egypt such as Thutmosis IV, Akhnaten, Nefertiti, and Tut Ankh Amon.
includes:
Round trip A/C transportation
Entrance fee
Services and taxes

title: Giza Pyramids and Sphinx: Half-Day Private Tour
experiences:
Learn the history of the Giza Pyramids and Sphinx
Enjoy a short camel ride around the Great Pyramid
Get there comfortably in air-conditioned, private transportation
fullDescription:
Meet your tour-guide in your hotel lobby and depart in a private, air-conditioned vehicle to the Giza Plateau.

The tour begins by exploring the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. You will visit the Pyramid of Cheops (The Great Pyramid of Giza), the largest pyramid in the world.

Continue your tour with visits to the Pyramids of Chephren and Mykerinos. Learn the architectural significance and fascinating history of these magnificent structures.

While on the Giza Plateau, you will see The Great Sphinx of Giza and learn about the mystery of one of the oldest and largest sculptures in the world.
includes:
Hotel pick-up and drop-off from Cairo

title: 1-Hour Felucca Ride on the Nile
experiences:
Cruise the Nile river and enjoy some of the stunning views on board your Felucca
Enjoy a spectacular sunset over the River Nile
Discover Cairo's nightlife
fullDescription:
Discover the river Nile as you cruise its waters in a traditional Felucca. Meet your guide in the lobby of your hotel and travel to the Nile pier in downtown Cairo and spend a day sailing down the same river Cleopatra did so many centuries ago. Enjoy a relaxing daytime cruise and let your hand glide along the Nile’s surface as you bathe in the warm Egyptian sun.

Choose to take the cruise later on in the day and experience a spectacular sunset over Cairo from the deck or your boat, or alternatively hop on board the Felucca after the sun has set and observe Cairo’s buzzing nightlife from the river.
includes:
Transfer service from and to hotel in air-conditioned vehicle

title: Cairo: Egyptian Museum & Khan El-Khalili
experiences:
Tour the marvels of the Egyptian Museum
Admire Tut-Ench-Amun’s collection
Enjoy shopping at Khan El-Khalili
fullDescription:
Journey to the heart of the pharaohs' civilization in an air-conditioned car that will pick you up from your hotel. Arrive in style at Tahrir Square in front of the Egyptian Museum, a majestic building constructed in 1902. The ground floor contains colossal statues spanning thousands of years, arranged in chronological order. Take an informative and enlightening tour of the upper floor, marveling at smaller statues, fossils, paintings, sarcophagi and ancient Egypt maps. The famous Tut-Ench-Amun also has an exclusive section in the museum. 

Before returning to your hotel stop by the vibrant colored market. The shops and bazaars display and sell a dizzying array of trinkets and artworks, giving you the chance to take home a small piece of Egyptian culture and civilization. Buy souvenirs for your friends or simply meander around the bustling shops.

Your guide will then drop you off at your hotel in Cairo.
includes:
All transfers in an air-conditioned vehicle
Port pick-up and drop off
Soft drinks during the drive
Entrance fees to all the attractions mentioned in the itinerary
Service charges and taxes

title: Cairo Day Tour with Entry Fees and Lunch
experiences:
Take a guided tour of the 3 Pyramids of Giza
See the famous treasures of King Tutankhamun at the Egyptian Museum
Visit a papyrus workshop
Enjoy lunch at a Cairo restaurant
fullDescription:
Visit the most famous sights of Cairo on a full-day guided tour. A tour representative will meet you outside your hotel for the transfer to Cairo by comfortable bus.

When you arrive in Cairo you’ll be met by an Egyptologist guide and begin your tour of discovery at the Pyramids of Giza. Learn about each of the 3 pyramids, Khufu, Khafra and Menkaure, and then visit the Great Sphinx, the monumental statue with the head of a pharaoh on the body of a lion.

Lunch will be served at a local restaurant in Cairo. Afterwards, your tour continues with a visit to the world-famous Egyptian Museum. The museum houses over 165,000 Egyptian artifacts and the immeasurable riches of the golden treasures of King Tutankhamun are undoubtedly the highlight of the exhibition.

The 6 Tutankhamun gold sarcophagi are found in the main exhibit area, with his magnificent death mask the most important piece of this collection. Your guide will tell you about other top exhibits, and you’ll have plenty of time to explore the museum on your own.

If you’d like to buy some souvenirs of your trip, you might find some items you like when you visit a papyrus workshop and see the production of these works of art.
includes:
Pick-up and drop off service from your hotel in Hurghada or Makadi Bay only
Round-trip transfers between Hurghada or Makadi Bay and Cairo by air-conditioned bus
Multilingual tour and guide

title: Cairo 4-Hour Guided Tour of the Egyptian Museum
experiences:
Discover the treasures of the Egyptian Museum with an Egyptologist guide
See the gold and jewelry that was entombed with King Tutankhamen
Enjoy transfers between your hotel and museum in air-conditioned comfort
fullDescription:
Add an in-depth tour of the Egyptian Museum to your stay in Cairo. You’ll visit the most important museum in Egypt with an Egyptologist as your guide.

On this 4-hour tour you’ll be picked up at your hotel and transferred to the Egyptian Museum, where your guide will show you highlights of the unbelievable collection of artifacts from the old, middle, and new kingdoms.

The museum house over 250,000 genuine artifacts, including the treasures of the most famous Egyptian pharaoh, Tutankhamen. The gold and jewelry on display was enclosed in his tomb for over 3,500 years before it was discovered in the 1920s during excavations.

At the end of the tour you’ll be transferred back to your hotel.

Egyptologist guide

title: Giza Pyramids and Egyptian Museum Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Explore the Great Pyramid of Giza and Great Sphinx
Take a tour of the Egyptian Museum with an expert guide
See artifacts from the pharaonic era and learn more about Ancient Egypt
fullDescription:
Journey by private air-conditioned vehicle to the Giza Plateau to discover one of the last remaining 7 Wonders of the World.

Benefit from the services of an Egyptologist guide at the Giza Pyramids complex and get detailed explanations about the structures, including the limestone statue of a reclining sphinx. 

Then, go to Cairo city center and enter the Egyptian Museum on Tahrir Square. Take a guided tour of the halls to see thousands of artifacts and learn more about the pharaonic era. Explore more than 5,000 years of Egyptian history through statues of kings, models of daily life and mummified animals.
includes:
Hotel pick-up and drop off in Cairo or Giza

title: From Hurghada: Full-Day Trip to Cairo by Plane
experiences:
Visit the famous pyramids of Giza
Admire the uniqueness of the Sphinx
Discover more about the history of the country at the Egyptian Museum
Enjoy shopping at the Khan el-Khalili market
fullDescription:
Travel from Hurghada to Cairo by plane, where you can enjoy an exciting day tour. You will be picked up at your hotel in Hurghada in an air-conditioned vehicle and transferred to the airport to catch a domestic flight to Cairo. Upon arrival in Cairo you will be greeted by the Egyptologist who will accompany you throughout the tour.

The tour starts in Giza, where you visit the famous and impressive pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinos as well as the Sphinx. After a break for a delicious lunch, the tour continues on to the Egyptian Museum. Here you can admire the treasures of the young pharaoh Tutankhamun as well as other artifacts. In the afternoon you can enjoy shopping at the Khan el-Khalili market.

At the end of the tour you’ll be transferred to the airport in Cairo to catch the flight back to Hurghada. Once there you’ll be transferred back to your hotel.
includes:
All transfers in an air-conditioned vehicle
Domestic flights (Hurghada – Cairo/Cairo – Hurghada)
Private tour guide

title: Half-Day Tour of Old Cairo & Khan El Khalili Bazaar
experiences:
Stop off at the Hanging Church and Ben Ezra Synagogue
See the Church of St. Barbara and the Church of Abu Serga
Browse the bazaar at Khan El Khalili
fullDescription:
Spend a half day seeing important cultural and historical sites in Cairo when you travel to Old Cairo and the Khan El Khalili Bazaar.

The bazaar is one of the most famous and oldest bazaars in all of the Middle East, dating back to 1382.

After spending time walking around the bazaar or shopping, continue to Old Cairo. Visit the Hanging Church, which dates back to the 3rd century AD. Then see the Ben Ezra Synagogue, which is, according to a local tradition, located on the site where Moses was found when he was a baby.

Continue on to see the Church of St. Barbara and the Church of Abu Serga, two of the oldest churches in Cairo.
includes:

title: Cairo Airport: Private Transfer Service
experiences:

Enjoy the comfort of our private air-conditioned vehicle
Relax and let us take care of your luggage for you
fullDescription:
If your plans call for a transfer from the Cairo Airport to a city hotel, our representative will meet you at the airport’s exit, holding a sign with your name on it. You’ll travel in air-conditioned comfort to the hotel. The car can accommodate up to 4 passengers.

On the other hand, if you’re traveling from your Cairo hotel to the airport, we’ll meet you at the reception area of your hotel in plenty of time to make your flight. Whether you’re arriving or departing, we’ll look after your luggage so that you can relax and enjoy yourself.

In order to avoid any delays due to heavy traffic in Cairo we always depart from city center hotels 3 hours before scheduled flight time.

title: Cairo Day Tour from Sharm El Sheikh by Air
experiences:
Take a full-day tour to Cairo from Sharm El Sheikh, including a return flight
Visit some of Cairo's most amazing sights and attractions, including the Great Pyramids and the Egyptian Museum
Enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant in Cairo
fullDescription:
Our representative will pick you up from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh. You will then be transferred to Sharm El Sheikh Airport to catch your flight to Cairo. At Cairo Airport you will be met and assisted by another of our representatives.

Our Egyptologist guide will accompany you to visit the great pyramid of Giza, which is the only existing wonder of the seven wonders of the ancient world. At the Giza plateau, you will not only see the great pyramid of Khufu, known as Cheops, but also the pyramid of Chefren, the pyramid of Mykerinus, the valley temple of Khefren and the iconic Great Sphinx. This amazing complex of structures dates back to almost 5,000 years ago.

From there, you will be taken to the Egyptian museum, which houses around 150,000 artifacts that date thousands of years to ancient Egyptian civilization. This is considered the largest and most precious collection of Egyptian art in the world. Take your chance to admire the incredible treasures of the boy-king Tutankhamun.

After the museum, you will also have the chance to wander in the oldest bazaar in the middle east, the Khan El Khalili Bazaar, where you will feel the atmosphere of living in Islamic Cairo hundreds of years ago. The bazaar dates back to 1382, A.D., and is just one of the fascinating places we will see, giving you a real taste of the ancient city of Cairo.

At the end of the day you will be transferred to Cairo Airport for a flight back to Sharm El Sheikh.

title: All-Inclusive Guided Tour of Luxor from Cairo by Plane
experiences:
Explore the most important treasures of the ancient world in Luxor led by an expert guide
Relax with return plane transfer from Cairo and air-conditioned transportation
Dine in a local restaurant with all food (not drinks) inclusive in the price
Experience the East Bank with the Luxor and Karnak temples
Explore the West Bank and visit the Valley of the Kings and the Colossi of Memnon
fullDescription:
Explore the many treasures of the ancient world on this all-inclusive day tour to Luxor from Cairo, traveling by plane and bus.

After being collected from your hotel in Cairo at around 05:30, drive by air-conditioned vehicle to the airport, ready to fly to Luxor. Your expert guide will meet you at the airport and your tour will begin.

Make an excursion to the Necropolis of Thebes on the Western Bank. Crossing the Nile, visit the Valley of the Kings, and see the grand tombs of some of the most powerful nobles and pharos of Ancient Egypt. On the return journey stop-off at the Colossi of Memnon, 2 gigantic statues representing Amenophis III facing the Nile. You will also have the chance to visit the famous Temple of Queen Hatshepsut.

Explore the Luxor Temple and marvel at the granite statues of Ramses the Great in the courtyard. Proceed by carriage or bus to Karnak–a series of temples spanning from different reigns and eras.

Walk through the Avenue of Sphinxes, visit the Hypostyle Hall with its 134 gigantic columns, see the Obelisks of Queen Hatshepsut and Tutomosis III, and witness the temple of Amon, adorned with exquisite lotus and papyrus designs.

After a whirlwind exploration into the treasures of the ancient world, transfer back to the airport for your return flight to Cairo, and to your hotel.

The Sphinx dates to the time of Chephren. This tour also includes a visit to the Valley Temple, which belongs to the Pyramid of Chephren.

Continue sightseeing with an exciting tour to the Step Pyramids of Zoser, the world's oldest major stone structure. It was built in the 3rd Dynasty (around 2630 BC) for King Djoser.

Transfer to Memphis, which was founded by King Menes, and was the capital of Old Egypt during the Old Kingdom. It was considered to be a center of rule and culture for over 3000 years. The Statue of Ramses II is a highlight of this stop.

Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Cairo or Giza, and then travel to the Giza Plateau to explore the pyramids of Ancient Egypt with an Egyptologist guide. experiences:

fullDescription:
Begin this half-day tour of the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx straight from your hotel in Cairo. Head toward the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus and discover the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, and the only one to remain largely intact. Egyptologists believe the Pyramid of Cheops (also known as the Great Pyramid of Giza) was built as a tomb for the Egyptian Pharaoh Khofo and constructed over a 14 to 20-year period in 2560 BC.

Afterwards, continue on toward the Great Sphinx. The Sphinx has the head of a pharaoh with a lion's body and dates back to the time of Chephren. This sphinx was made to guard the pyramids of King Chefren. Next, visit the Valley Temple which belonged to the Pyramids of Chephren. The temple acted as a place for the purification and mummification process of the king before burial.

title: From Cairo: Full-Day Tour of Giza Pyramids & Simon Cave

experiences:

fullDescription:
Enjoy a fantastic orientation tour of Cairo on an 8-hour excursion that takes in the major monuments of Old Cairo and the maze of streets and stalls of the historic Khan El Khalili Bazaar.

Following a hotel pick-up from Cairo or Giza, you will drive up to the Saladin Citadel, constructed by Salah al-Din on the Moqattam Hills in 1183 AD as a defence against Crusader armies. Known for its fresh air and sweeping views of Cairo, it is now a preserved historic site of mosques and museums, including the Mosque of Muhammad Ali Pasha.

Designed by the Turkish architect Yousif Boushnaq, who came to Cairo especially from Istanbul to build the great building, the mosque's alabaster structure stands in beautiful contrast to the sandstone city. Continue to the Khan el-Khalili Bazaar, one of the oldest bazaars in the Middle East. Discover a maze of alleys that has been at the center of Cairo’s trading activities since the 14th century.

Then, visit Old Cairo to see major attractions such as the Hanging Church, the Ben Ezra Synagogue, the Church of St. Barbara, and the Church of Abu Serga, one of the oldest Coptic churches in Cairo.

title: Giza Pyramids & Egyptian Museum from Hurghada by Bus
experiences:
See the best of Cairo's monuments in one day

fullDescription:
Explore the best of Cairo’s monuments on a full-day coach tour from Hurghada, and see the Giza Plateau and Egyptian Museum, home to more than 120,000 relics of Egyptian history.

A tour representative will pick you up at 02:30 from your Hurghada hotel for the coach transfer to Cairo. Upon arrival, your Egyptologist guide will take you to the stunning Pyramids of Giza in the Giza Plateau. The oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, the pyramids of Cheops, Khafre and Mykerinos form the major highlight of the Giza Necropolis.

Tour the massive mortuary tombs of the Pharaohs, and the Great Sphinx statue, constructed in the shape of a lion’s body with a human head. Explore the Valley Temple before a light lunch at a local restaurant.

Continue into central Cairo to wander the galleries of the remarkable Egyptian Museum, home to an astonishing collection of relics from the pre-dynastic era to the Pharaonic era and the Greco-Roman period. A highlight of its treasures are the artifacts of the child King Tutankhamen, but look too at the displays of other Pharaonic Gods and Goddess, and visit the mummies room to learn about mummification art in ancient Egypt.

Finally, visit the Khan El Khalili Market, the oldest market in the Middle East, and search for unique souvenir gifts, before the drive back to Hurghada.

title: From Cairo: Alexandria Day Tour
experiences:
See the library of Alexandria and the statues of Alexander and Ptolemy keeping watch outside
Wander around the markets in the old city center where you're sure to find a treasure or two
Explore the Montaza Gardens surrounding the palace
Admire the Abbo Elabbas Mosque, the most beautiful mosque in the city
Stop for unique photo opportunities
fullDescription:
Alexandria has so much to see, feel, eat and buy – fit in as much of it as possible on this day tour from Cairo. Start your day trip to Alexandria with pick-up from your accommodation in a comfortable vehicle. The first stop on this full-day tour will be a visit to the Library of Alexandria, the biggest library in the world. Now housing 8 million books, you can visit its open court to see the statues of Alexander the Great and Ptolemy the First keeping watch over the library. 
 
The car will then whisk you off to the Church of St. Mark, the oldest church in Africa. Then, continue on to the old downtown of Alexandria where you can walk through traditional markets where everything and anything is sold. Admire the downtown’s Baroque designs and Italian- and French-style properties. If you choose, have lunch in a famous restaurant called “Mohamed Ahmed’s” – the Queen of Spain has eaten here! Take a break in a coffee shop or shisha café before continuing on with your tour.
 
Continue your Alexandria adventure in the afternoon with a packed itinerary of sights. See the city’s oldest market area which contains both the women’s markets and the most spectacular gold market where everyone buys their wedding jewelry. See the prettiest and largest mosque in the city, the Abbo Elabbas Mosque, and the ancient fun-fair located just outside of it where children still play. Opposite is the corniche and old harbour where you can see fishing boats and traditional fishers making nets. From here, walk 5 minutes to see the Quaitbay castle. See Memorial of the Unknown Soldier, and the beautiful coastline on the way to the Montaza Palace and Gardens (also known as the Love Garden for its popularity with couples!). All of these will make for excellent photo opportunities, so don't forget your camera. Finally, cross over the modern Bridge of Stanley before travelling in comfort back to your hotel.

The first step of the day tour is to the home of the monuments to the Pharaohs’ history. This museum  hosts more than 120,000 rare artifacts from the Three Kingdoms, At least half of which are on display. You have two “full” floors with 107 halls to view. While the ground floor holds heavy statutes,  the second floor contains the small statues, papyrus, the mummies and the world’s most extensive collection of the boy King of Tut-Ench-Amun. Take your time discovering his shining items, but pull yourself from the bewitching room and put in mind, the most astonishing has not been shown yet.

title: From Cairo: Overnight Trip to Alexandria
experiences:
See the catacombs of Kom El Shokafa
Stop for a photo at Pompay's Pillar
Walk through the Library of Alexandria Manuscripts museum
Discover the Castle of Kaitbey
Visit the Montaza Gardens and the Palaces
fullDescription:
On day one, you will be picked up from your hotel and begin the journey to Alexandria. Once there, visit the insides of the Catacombs of Kom El Shokafa which are the largest Roman Cemetery consisting of three levels cut in the rock. 

Then, drive to visit the Roman Amphitheater of Alexandria with the display of the sunken monuments of Alexandria which were discovered under the East harbor of Alexandria. You will also drive by Pompay’s Pillar and stop for a photo stop. 

After that, visit the Citadel of Quaitbay from inside and take outstanding photos inside and outside of it before heading to the library of Alexandria. Visit it’s open court where you can see the statue of Alexander the Great and the statue of Ptolemy the first. There, visit the library's reading halls, president Saddat Museum, and the impressions of Alexandria Museum.

The car will then take you to visit the church of St. Mark, the oldest church in Africa, and El Nabi Daniel Mosque before taking you back to your hotel to stay overnight in Alexandria. 

On day two, be picked up from your hotel by your tour guide after breakfast. Then, travel to the biggest mosque in the city, the Abbo Elabbas Mosque before continuing to see the outside of Quaitbay castle which was built on the same site as the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria, one of the seven wonders of the world. 

Next, head to the gardens of Montaza where you can visit the royal gardens of King Farouk and see the royal palaces of Haramlek and Salamlek as well as walk along the famous Montaza bridge.

On your way back, stop over the famous bridge of Stanley, the landmark of modern Alexandria before returning to Cairo with an A/C car.

experiences:
Visit the Egyptian Museum and see masterpieces of art and artifacts from Dynastic Egypt
See the Pyramids of Giza

fullDescription:
Early in the morning, around 2:30, you will be picked up from your hotel in El Gouna or its vicinity, to travel in an air-conditioned minibus or car, to Cairo. The journey lasts around 5 hours.

At the half-way point you will stop for a rest and a break at a service station. The day will be long, and full of excitement, so we recommend you sleep through this part of the journey, taking you through the desert, where there isn't so much to see.

When you arrive in Cairo your guide will be waiting for you by the Egyptian Museum. He will accompany you the whole day.

The first thing you will see is the Egyptian Museum. Your guide will take you through the vast museum, showing you the masterworks of the collection, and explaining them expertly. By the time you're finished it will be midday, and time for lunch.

After lunch you will go to see the pyramids of Giza. You can examine each of the pyramids from outside at your pleasure, and with a little luck (there is a limited number of guests allowed inside each day) enter the chambers inside, for an extra fee. After this exploration of history, you will have a chance to see Egyptian life as it is today, in the Khan-el-Khalili bazaar. It is the largest bazaar in the whole of the Middle East, and still retains its characteristic ancient flavor.

The return journey to Hurghada/El Gouna is at around 17:00.

Come along on this exclusive tour, and immerse yourself in the past!

See the Sphinx
Enjoy lunch in Cairo
Wander through Khan el-Khalili bazaar
Visit the step pyramids of Sakkara and Memphis
fullDescription:
Enjoy the variety of Egypt and visit Cairo from Hurghada.

An air-conditioned car will bring you from your hotel to Hurghada airport where you will board your flight to Cairo. On arrival in the Egyptian capital, an Egyptologist guide will be waiting for your arrival.

The journey begins in Giza, where you will visit 3 of Egypt's largest and most famous pyramids. The Great Pyramid is the oldest, and is the last remaining Wonder of the 7 Wonders of the World. The tip of the Pyramid of Khafre is still partially covered with limestone. The Pyramid of Menkaure is surrounded by 3 other, much smaller pyramids.

Visit the step pyramids of Sakkara. The necropolis of Sakkara is the next most important burial site of Lower Egypt, after Giza. The largest and most impressive burial site is that of the Pharaoh Djoser, from the 3rd dynasty of the Old Kingdom, around 2650 B.C. He is buried in a famous step pyramid.

You will also visit Memphis, the old capital city, where you will see ruins and the giant toppled statue of the Pharaoh Ramses II, as well as the Alabaster Sphinx.

In the afternoon you can visit Khan el-Khalili bazaar to go shopping. You'll also get to visit the famous antiques market in Cairo.

After an unforgettable day, you will be brought back to the airport in Cairo in the evening. Fly back to Hurghada where you will be transferred back to your hotel having enjoying a great day in the Egyptian capital.

All transfers in an air-conditioned vehicle
Internal flights (Hurghada/Cairo/Hurghada)

experiences:

fullDescription:
Once you arrive at the Egyptian Museum of Antiquities, which is located in Tahrir square, you'll find a representative who will give you your tickets. Or, if you've selected a transportation option, be picked up from your hotel in downtown Cairo or Giza and taken to the museum in a comfortable air-conditioned bus. Then you'll be ready to explore the fascinating exhibitions that will teach you all about Egypt's past, and in fact show you rare and unique items from each era of the country's history.

Constructed in 1902, this is the largest museum in the region and houses 250,000 rare artifacts of all sizes. The ground floor contains the large heavy statues arranged in chronological order. Then take a tour of the upper floor to see the smaller statues, fossils, paintings, sarcophagi and ancient Egyptian maps. Be sure to visit the exclusive section dedicated to Tutankhamun to see all his treasures, which were discovered in his tomb in Luxor, including his golden mask. Be sure to set aside the whole day to cover the vast expanses of time and space that this museum covers!

title: Cairo: Half-Day Mummies & Pyramids Tour

experiences:

fullDescription:
Take a 4-day luxury Nile cruise and admire the beauty of the Nile River Valley. See the important sites in Luxor, including the Karnak Temple, Temple of Queen Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. In Aswan, you’ll visit the Philae temple and the High Dam. Travel by VIP first-class train between Cairo and Aswan.

Detailed Itinerary
Day 1
Transfer to the Cairo train station to catch the overnight train to Aswan.

Day 2: Aswan – Kom Ombo (Meals: Lunch, Dinner)
Arrival in Aswan, where you’ll meet your tour representative at the train station. Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple before transferring to the cruise ship. Lunch and afternoon tea will be served on board. Sail to Kom Ombo. Dinner and overnight on board.

Day 3: Kom Ombo – Edfu – Luxor (Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
After breakfast, visit the Temple of Kom Ombo. Sail to Edfu. After lunch, visit the Temple of Horus. Cross Esna Lock and sail to Luxor. Overnight on board.

Day 4: Luxor West Bank (Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
Breakfast on board. Cross to the West Bank to visit the Valley of the Kings. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari. See the Colossi of Memnon and visit an alabaster institute. Afternoon tea and dinner and overnight on board.

Day 5: Luxor East Bank (Meals: Breakfast)
Breakfast on board before disembarkation from the cruise ship. Visit the East Bank of the Nile, taking in the Temple of Karnak, the Temple of Luxor, and the Obelisk of Ramses II. Transfer to the train station to catch the overnight train back to Cairo.

Day 6
Arrival in Cairo and transfer to your hotel.

The next stop on your day tour is the Step Pyramid of King Djoser, at the fascinating Sakkara archeological site. Built in the 3rd Dynasty (around 2630 B.C.E.), this special pyramid is the world's oldest major stone structure.

From the Step Pyramids transfer to Memphis, the former capital city of ancient Egypt during the Old Kingdom. Having once reigned as a cultural center for over 3,000 years, Memphis offers stunning ancient sites and intrigue.

experiences:

fullDescription:
Day 1: Pyramids of Giza and the Egyptian Museum

You will be met in your hotel by your guide and picked up by an air-conditioned van. Start your day by visiting the Egyptian Museum. You will get to see 165,000 Egyptian artifacts. The priceless treasures of King Tutankhamen are the highlight here. His six gilded coffins dominate the main hall, while his magnificent death mask is the star attraction. You can also visit the Mummies Hall (additional cost). Next, enjoy sailing along the Nile on a small boat and watch the sites of the city (optional).

You will have your lunch in a restaurant located by the river Nile. Next stop on your tour is the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx, one of the Seven Wonders of the World and still a riddle today. A truly unforgettable experience, the Sphinx is an enigmatic symbol of Egypt. You will have free time to enter one of the pyramids (additional cost) if you wish. You will also have a chance to do some shopping and visit a perfume factory and traditional Papyrus Institute, where you can see how they make papyrus and purchase a unique gift. Then, drive back to your hotel.

Day 2: Islamic and Coptic Cairo 

Have amazing day trip to old Islamic and Coptic Cairo, where you will walk in the oldest streets between ancient Islamic and Coptic monuments. You will be picked up by your guide to visit the Hanging Church (named for its location above a gatehouse of the Babylon Fortress.) Then, you will visit the Coptic Museum with the largest collection of Egyptian Christian artifacts in the world. Near by the Coptic Museum you will find located Ben Ezra Synagogue. This was the synagogue whose geniza or store room was found in the 19th century to contain a treasure of abandoned Hebrew. Next, you will visit the Citadel of Saladin which is a fortification in Cairo. You will then have lunch followed by a walk through Khan El Khalili Street. You could ask yourself how a market in Egypt is responsible for the founding of the United States. This is an experience you will find unforgettable. Return back to your hotel.

fullDescription:
This 4-hour sightseeing tour explores the mysteries of the Great Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx in the Giza Plateau. The oldest and last remaining of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, the site is not only the most popular attraction in Egypt, it’s one of the most loved destinations in the world.

In the company of an expert Egyptologist guide, you will visit the Pyramid of Cheops, the middle Pyramid of Chephren, and the small Pyramid of Mykerinos. Continue to the Great Sphinx with its head of a man and body of a lion, gazing imposingly across the valley.

title: Great Pyramids of Giza Half-Day Adventure
experiences:
Visit the iconic Pyramids of Giza before the crowds and the heat
Snap those photos you’ve always wanted, without pesky tourists getting in the way
Marvel at one of the true ancient masterpieces: the Sphinx and his Pyramids
Indulge in a local lunch, making this tour of the Pyramids just a little bit different than the rest
fullDescription:
Get ready, get set, for an experience of a lifetime – a half-day trip to the Great Pyramids of Giza!               

The Giza Plateau is a formation of three pyramids, where a father, son, and grandson constructed their afterlife tombs and mapped their journeys to the afterlife. It’s still a bit of a mystery as to how the pyramids were constructed and how long they took to complete, but there’s no question that the pyramids still represent the pinnacle of ancient Egyptian architectural accomplishments. The whole area, really, continues to hold many secrets yet to be uncovered, making the pyramids one of the most alluring and inviting places in the world. 

Why not tick off that bucket list item, and then some, with a half-day tour to the pyramids that’s going to prove to you why everyone reveres this site so much. What sets this Pyramids tour apart from the others is that you'll beat the tourists and arrive at the Giza Plateau well before the crowds and that ruthless midday sun. You'll also be treated to a local lunch! Pyramids, Sphinx, and lunch? Oh my! 

The day starts by seeing the guardian of the necropolis, the Sphinx (you know, the one with the missing nose!), which stands in front of the second Pyramid of Khepren. Enter the Giza Plateau from the Sphinx Gate to beat the crowds to the site, and after seeing the Sphinx, walk to the mysterious great pyramid of King Cheops, where you can marvel at the sheer size of the construction, and try and formulate your own theories as to how it was built. 

The Pyramids tour continues to the second Pyramid of Giza, which is the second largest and the only pyramid that still caries part of its original casing. From there, continue to the third and the smallest of the Giza Plateau pyramids. And no visit to the Pyramids of Giza would be complete without stopping at the panoramic view point where you get to see the all the pyramids of Giza in the one spot (and take a photo like the ones you see in travel books – free of tourists! Well, almost…) 

Leaving the amazing pyramids behinds, head back out to the streets of Cairo and stop by a local restaurant for lunch. You'll be treated to Koshary, a dish of rice, pasta, lentils, fried onions, and chili sauce, and a favorite amongst young local Egyptians. After lunch, you'll be dropped back off at one of the starting points, where you can carry on your day (although the Pyramids are sure to have already been the highlight!).
includes:
Local English-speaking guide
Pyramids area entrance fees
Koshary lunch

fullDescription:
Your tour begins with an easy hotel pickup, where your guide will be awaiting you in your hotel lobby. Now the fun really begins.

Journey back in time to the days of the Ancient Egyptians to see the legendary pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Get an up close look at the Great Sphinx, and visit the Valley Temple on the site where the ancient pharaohs were laid to rest. This is a family friendly tour, so kids are welcome!

Take a camel ride through the desert and feel just like an ancient Egyptian. This is truly an unforgettable experience!

Next, take a history tour of Cairo, which will take you along all the lesser known but must-see local spots. Take in the panoramic views of the Pyramids and the Sphinx, make an optional stop at Taverna's for local Cairo food, and visit the Egyptian Museum to see Egypt's hidden treasures. The city has a rich local history, ranging from the ancients to modern time. Learn about what is going on in Cairo today! Meet the locals, who will show you how to make the most of your trip.

At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.
includes:
Transfers are by modern and air conditioned vehicle
Tour guide
Entrance fees
All service charges and taxes
